intro: Galium sylvaticum subsp. aristatum, commonly known as the arrow-leaved bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often sprawling stems. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a distinctive pointed tip, giving it its common name. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium sylvaticum subsp. aristatum typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
